subject: Sexual Health
title: Hepatitis B
description: A quick, practical guide to Hepatitis B.

hook.text: A virus that attacks the liver spreads through sexual contact, blood, and from mother to child.

buildup.text: Hepatitis B can cause acute illness with fatigue, jaundice, and nausea lasting weeks or months.

discovery.text: In about 5% of adults, the virus becomes chronic, slowly damaging the liver over decades.

twist.text: A safe and effective vaccine has existed since 1982, yet 300 million people still live with the virus.

climax.text: Vaccination at birth can prevent hepatitis B entirely. It is one of medicine's greatest success stories.

punchline.text: A preventable disease still affecting millions.
